data.title: April is Month of the Military Child - Operation Prepare - The US Navy
data.meta_description: April is Month of the Military Child - Operation Prepare - The US Navy
data.text: NSA’S MISSION STATEMENT: “TO PROVIDE QUALITY SUPPORT TO U.S. AND NATO PERSONNEL, ACTIVITIES, AND AFLOAT UNITS IN OUR GEOGRAPHIC AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY. TO ENSURE RELIABLE COMMAND AND CONTROL OF ALL SUPPORT PROVIDED TO THOSE UNITS.” Visit us on the Web http://www.cnic.navy.mil/Naples/index.htm • Like us on Facebook U.S. Naval Support Activity Naples Serving the Nato, Naples and Gaeta military communities in italy 56th year, No. 13 Friday, apriL 1, 2011 Naples' weekend forecast FRIDAY High 68 Low 50 PARTLY CLOUDY SATURDAY High 70 Low 50 PARTLY CLOUDY SPE DIZ I ONE IN A.P. - 45% - ART. 2 COMMA 20/B LEGGE 662/96 - FIL I ALE DI NAP O LI Mario Bowen, Kelan Copeland, Angela Rojo, Anthony Scroggins and Moana Roberson enjoy the 2010 Month of the Military Child celebration at the NSA Naples Youth Center. (Photo courtesy of MWR) April is Month of the Military Child From “Panorama” staff Today marks the first day of Month of the Military Child! During the entire month of April, Naval Support Activity (NSA) Naples joins U.S. military installations around the globe in recognizing the contributions and sacrifices service members' sons and daughters make each day. see MILITARY CHILD Page 10 NMCRS Fund Drive: Give online The Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society (NMCRS) now has an online giving option! Visit http://bit.ly/fdIpzl to make your donation today. Print out the receipt and give it to your command’s NMCRS Fund Drive representative to ensure 100% contact and accurate accounting. The fund drive continues through April 15. (Photo of a NMCRS thrift shop in 1960 courtesy of NMCRS) Story time at the library is just one of many activities going on this month in celebration of Month of the Military Child. (Photo courtesy of MWR Libraries) SUNDAY High 70 Low 50 SUNNY In one end, out the other Beginning Monday, April 4, the west (front) gate will be open for inbound traffic only in support of gate security upgrades. All outbound traffic will be routed through the east (back) gate. Flagmen and signs will be posted. This traffic pattern will continue until May 13. Pedestrian traffic will be allowed at both gates. Events around town this weekend • Through 2 – More than 300 short films from around the world will be shown at Istituto Le Grenoble on via Crispi as part of “’O Curt,” Naples’ 13th annual short film festival. • 1 – Oscar Wilde’s “Ghosts of Canterville” will be performed in English at Edenlandia Celebrate Month of the Military Child • April 5 Discuss Erin Hunter’s “Into the Wild,” the first book of the famous “Warriors” series. Meet at the Support Site Library at 4 p.m. Light refreshments will be served. Books, graphic novels, gadgets and much more—don’t miss out! • April 7, 14, 21 and 28 Story Time at the Support Site Library for preschoolers. • April 9 Climbing Wall at Carney Park from 9:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Develop your rock climbing skills on a 25-foot outdoor climbing wall that has three experience level routes with autobelay protection. This activity is free. • April 9 Lago D’Averno Family Trek from 1 to 4 p.m. Enjoy a beautiful hike near Monte Nuovo along Lago D’Averno, which mythology suggests is an entrance to Dante’s Inferno. This easy hike for the whole family is free. Sign up by calling the NOR Center at 081-526-1579. • April 10 JUMPITZ performs live! Absolutely free concert for kids of all ages! Check out the group at http://www. jumpitz.com/. Location and time TBD. Call 081-568-4880 for more information. • April 11 Beyond the Piggy Bank: A Teen’s Guide to Saving Learn how to make your money grow during this onehour workshop taught by FFSC from 2 to 3 p.m. Get some helpful tips on how to save and what do once you’ve reached your savings goals. Call 081-811-6372 to reserve your spot. • April 12 Italian Game for Kids Head to FFSC from 10 to 11 a.m. to learn how to play a fun Italian game. Call 081-811- 6372 to reserve your spot. • April 13 and 27 Auto Skills Center Teens, learn how to check a vehicle’s vital fluids, brakes, windshield wipers, tires, radiator, seat belts, etc. on your current or future vehicle. This class is free! Call 081-811-4971/4947 for more information. • April 13 Four Museums Tour with ITT Visit four of the famous museums in Naples: the Museum of Paleontology, where you will find fossils and artifacts; at the Museum of Mineralogy, you will find over 3,500 rare and precious finds from all over the world; the Museum of Zoology houses a large number of different creatures from all over the globe; the Museum of Anthropology is known for with its archaeological collections as well as human and animal bones. This will be a fun, learning experience for adults and kids! Only €15 per adult and child. Call ITT at 081-568-4488 or 081-811-7907. • April 19 Special Community Gym Fun Time Enjoy a myriad of fun activities planned by Child & Youth Programs. 9 to 10 a.m. Music and Fun 10 to 11 a.m. First Tee Fun 11 a.m. to 12 p.m. Playground Playfulness on new SAC playground • April 20 Family Night Join Youth Activities from 5:30 to 7 p.m. for fun in Central Park. Activities include First Tee with SAC and special guest Golf Pro Richard Knapp, face painting with Naples Teen Center, a kids coloring booth with FFSC, fun on the new playground, music by the Dirty Sock Band and food and beverages! see EVENTS Page 10 APRIL EVENTS Page 16 beginning at 8:30 p.m. Tickets are sold 30 minutes prior to curtain. • 3 – Soccer fans will revel in the rivalry as Napoli and Lazio face off at Stadio San Paolo at 12:30 p.m. Check out http://wikinapoli.com/events for more information.
